website_summaries.verdict: For ease of installation and cooling a large space, this is a good bet.
pros: Includes a thermometer and humidifier to start and stop itself
Can cool up to 4,800 square feet
cons: It may automatically stay on all the time if the humidity and temperature are right

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, but noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fan unit, well built. Install is easy, plugs into typical duplex receptacle. What I like about this unit is that it’s a variable speed fan, not the typical single speed, and adjust its speed automatically as needed. What I don’t like about this unit is, that its very loud. Mine is install in the 2nd floor attic, and I can hear it from my 1st floor master bedroom, has a very loud hum through the wall. Can be a little annoying during hot summer nights. I’m planning on remounting, using some kind of insulator. Hopefully that will help with the noise level.
customer_reviews.author: Valhouse

customer_reviews.title: and noise level of the fan are good. I installed this in November in the Pacific ...
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality, function, and noise level of the fan are good. I installed this in November in the Pacific Northwest, and was surprised that the fan never turns off. I suspected it was the humidistat keeping the fan running, but called to clarify. I was informed the fan will continue to run if the humidity level is over 65%. My attic is very dry, but the humidity level in the area is well over 65% through the winter. Therefore, unless I want the fan to be running 24/7, a separate thermostat switch will need to be added. It would be nice to have a solution for this issue in the original set up of the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you live in somewhere hot you need this.
customer_reviews.text: Best money I have spent in a while. I was able to install it myself but had to frame around my gable vent. I live in the SFV and it is absurdly hot. It was probably 130 in my crawlspace but once I got the fan on it cooled it off in minutes. House is noticeably cooler. Quiet operation.
customer_reviews.author: Splicer

customer_reviews.title: Tech support is fabulous, no fault - shipped me a new one
customer_reviews.text: I guess i got one of the 2% lemons outside their promised 98% satisfaction rate...mine stopped working/turning on at the advertised 80 degrees, and sometimes it would come on at up to 125 degrees...then one day it completely died. Tech support / customer service is truely as they advertise..."one of the best in the industry"..atleast, for me it was; they sent me off a new fan same day, and even thou i would have preferred that it just WORKED as advertised, and i have to crawl in the attic again, this alternative is better than them just blowing me off, like most companies seem to do anymore. three stars is only, because in HATE to crawl in the ATTIC lol
customer_reviews.author: Big Howdy -

customer_reviews.title: A Necessary improvement to an older house
customer_reviews.text: I have use this for about a year now, it works well , it does make a difference in house temperature in these crazy hot days. Noise level is acceptable, the only think I will do is to have a bypass switch installed ,reason for that is that every once in awhile I like to be able to turn it off so it does not cool my house to much special in spring and fall seasons, I think the humidity sensor is a bit to sensitive so it runs too much at times
customer_reviews.author: Dorel

customer_reviews.title: Best fan in the world!
customer_reviews.text: I wondered about the "smart" feature of this fan. Shouldn't have. The fan responds exactly as described, I'll never need to worry about unplugging it for the winter, or setting a thermostat. Even at maximum speed it takes less than 150 watts and pumps a massive amount of air. I've built electronically controlled motors myself -- the engineers who designed this motor really know their business. None of this would matter if the attic didn't see a significant temperature difference, but it's cooler by about 30 degrees! I think this fan will pay for itself in less than one year in reduced air conditioner use. Thanks, Amazon and Quiet Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dropped my AC usage by 15 minutes per hour
customer_reviews.text: I use a Nest thermostat in my house which has a graph of AC usage throughout every day. On the 100 degree days before installation it showed a solid block all afternoon. On the days since installation it's changed to show a 15 minute gap every hour where the AC actually turns off.
customer_reviews.author: A. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief. Instant cook down.
customer_reviews.text: This fan turned our fully air conditioned home from a sweat box to chilly in two days!! It was extremely easy to install, it took about an hour. The change happened in one day. Everything just cooled off even though it continued to be in the high 80’s. We thought we’d have to get a new heat pump. Nope. We’re all set. Amazing. Can’t say enough. Wonderful product. And we cannot hear a thing! 😁
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Instant Results!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. I wish I had done this years ago. This was very easy to install and we saw results on day one. Our house is a mid 80s tract home with central heat and air. During the summer, the upstairs always was several degrees warmer. One could feel the heat energy soaking into the ceiling and walls and it took a long time for the AC to pull down the temp. This fan removed that heat and the house feels more balanced. The AC runs for a shorter amount of time now since it has less less work to do. You will not regret buying this product. Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fan!
customer_reviews.text: Worth spending a few buck for a better fan. Thermostat and humidity sensor built right in and located right on the motor. Great service from the manufacturer, too, as I had a question on the sensor location and they responded right away. Auto variable motor, so will save money in long run. And Made in U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K

customer_reviews.title: SUPER POWERFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so description is incorrect about as low as 15 watts. This arrived showing 22 watts. Not a huge difference, but be honest and update your description. Tonight will be first time it really does its job so can't wait!! Son bought one a week ago and loves his.
customer_reviews.author: Infotekkie

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it was to install given that it had just a few screws and a really long power cord that could be plugged into an outlet. I thought it was expensive compared to competitive products, but I chose this model because it was one of few with a humidistat. In my search it seemed that this was the best gable fan model on the market.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Went in pretty easy. I bought plywood and cut a hole to mount to. My old one was from 1950 and thought it was time for an upgrade. As soon as I plugged it in it kicked on high and dropped the temp down. It works well, seems well built. Time will tell, but right now it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Impaleale

customer_reviews.title: Must have gable fan! Plug and play!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this fan not only was it easy to install because all I did was plug it in to an outlet it really does keep my attic cooler. The 1st thing you'll notice is that your AC unit will not turn on as frequently throughout the day. I definitely recommend it as a Gable fan.
customer_reviews.author: C master

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It's so quiet that I went and purchased the QuietCool Trident Pro whole house fan to replace my 20 year old ceiling mounted attic fan. The product is quality and a good deal. Works very well based on temp and humidity. Highly recommend it for your attic to reduce heat buildup in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, cool attic.
customer_reviews.text: May cost a little more but its much quieter than others. Correct mounting with any fan is critical also and this was easily done. Certainly has been helping keep or home cooler. The Tstat and automatic speed adjustment seem works very well. The price is a bit higher than others but build quality and function is also higher.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great answer for a gable attic fan!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my vented attic, mounted it in the gable end. The install was very easy as the unit is light and easy to handle by yourself. The directions are very clear to follow as well, I have to be standing directly under where the fan is located in the living space to hear that it is running and it is very efficient using a fraction of what other fans do. I bought a second one for my garage!
customer_reviews.author: R. Holst

customer_reviews.title: Great Design,  Poorly built and funky software
customer_reviews.text: I needed to properly attach the fan to the support that clearly hadn't been done in the factory I needed to reinstall the ground wires in the control box that clearly had not been done in the factory I was missing one of the 4 surrounds but when I called to get one, it would have taken me much longer to provide all the information they wanted than to build one myself and submit this review.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgar

customer_reviews.title: This fan was super easy to install in our attic gable
customer_reviews.text: This fan was super easy to install in our attic gable, luckily we already had a vent that it fit behind. the only complaint I have is that its a little loud. its mounted above our garage so we cant hear it from inside of our house. I'm glad that I didn't mount it over a bedroom or living room.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: We had quiet cool house fans on our previous house in SoCal, loved it. Put this gable fan in our 36' x 48' RV garage and it's great. Crack a window or open one of the double doors a foot and it pulls the outside are through the bldg cooling it very well.
customer_reviews.author: PDB6985

customer_reviews.title: very quiet
customer_reviews.text: The fan is easy to install if you have basic understanding and tools (skill saw screw gun level ) plug and play. I also bought a vent which I would strongly suggest, Broan 433 Automatic Shutter for 353 and 35316 Gable Mount Attic Ventilator
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Osha II

customer_reviews.title: Very loud, doesn't move as much air as it should and way overpriced....
customer_reviews.text: This unit is extremely noisy... I guess the performance/value is the only thing "quiet" about this thing... attic is blistering hot and this fan isn't even on high or it is and just doesn't work.. buy two 60 dollar units and be done with it...
customer_reviews.author: PreciseD

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install
customer_reviews.text: Works well with smart phone app and simple to install.
customer_reviews.author: Rockl

customer_reviews.title: Best design on the market
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and functions as designed. Well built and variable speed motor super quiet at low speeds and considering the air movement at high speed I really don’t have anything to complain about. Temperatures in the 90’s this week and attic is sooo much better. Would definitely recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fairly quite - effectivity evaluated in summer
customer_reviews.text: Just installed in Bay Are California two story home attic. So far so good. Not much noisy but room below can feel that there is fan running in the attic. Will see in summer if it is effective or very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh Garg

customer_reviews.title: I wish I bought a different fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan is noisy and causes vibrations and noise within the house. It also runs even when it is 50 degrees outside. I should have bought a wifi-enabled fan that allows me to adjust the temperature and humidity controls.
customer_reviews.author: Tim from Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.  Reduces energy use!
customer_reviews.text: Reduced our electric bill tremendously for air conditioning. Used much less air conditioning due to venting heat from the attic in summer
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Takes a matter of minutes to position, screw on and trim plastic flanges for sealing up. The unit just plugs in (long cord provided) and adjusts speed according to heat/humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation; Instructions are lacking
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation, real a mount and plug device. If it works as advertised a great idea (have to wait till next year to see if it truly works since it is fall/winter). Relatively quiet when plug in test was being done.
customer_reviews.author: FxB

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit to install . We had a cool summer . Goes off when temp cools at night . I also put a kill switch for winter
customer_reviews.author: dean fluss

customer_reviews.title: Died after one year.
customer_reviews.text: This product was pretty good while it lasted. The noise level was alright, but vibrated down the wall even with rubber padding. It lasted a little over a year. I went to turn it on for the first time this year and its dead. Not worth money. Update: the manufacturer sent me a new motor that works. I just need to return the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: Put it in our garage - very near the bedroom window, but the noise level is so that no bother at night.
customer_reviews.author: NV

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet
customer_reviews.text: Not quiet at all. Can hear rumbling anytime it’s on
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Baughn

customer_reviews.title: Fast install, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Had it up & running in 15 minutes! Felt the difference the first day, can't wait to see my power bill.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalez's

customer_reviews.title: Fan works great
customer_reviews.text: The second story of my house would always be 5-10 degrees warmer than the first floor. I installed this fan in my attic and it instantly cooled the second story
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Simple installation.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Far exceeds my expectations. The temperature in the back rooms of my house was 105-110 on 100 degree days prior to installation of this unit. After installing it the temps are usually around 85.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie R Farrington

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Virtually silent. Only runs at higher speed during the heat of the day but even then it is barely audible. Find myself peeking into the attic to watch it run. Perfection. Has lowered the temperature in our two story house by a good 5 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan
customer_reviews.text: It only took me about 30 minutes to get this fan installed and operational. I could feel the cool air rushing through my attic shortly after it began to run. This fan is quite and I’m unable to hear it in the house. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Not as keen on the variable speed as I thought I'd be
customer_reviews.text: So I thought I'd really like the variable speed, and the reduction in noise that would come along with it. The reality is that I wish I'd purchased a single speed fan, with an external temperature sensor, and dealt with a bit more external noise, but an overall increased air flow. If this item allowed for setting of the speeds at various temperatures, I'd get along with it, and while it does a reasonable job, I'd not purchase again and go with the lower priced single speed fan, and enjoyed more airflow. Live and learn, and too late to return, but let my error help others.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: New house, noisey and continuous operation. Installed late in season, but quiet as a church mouse and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Turrisi

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan that automatically adjusts it speed to the temperature. It's a bit noisy but the benefits outweigh the minor sound.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fan!!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but felt the need after installing this fan. I mounted it in the attic above the second story. The fan was super easy to install, directions were great, and it’s really quiet. I have to lower my attic door to hear it running. Very impressed with the build quality. I can feel the difference upstairs and my attic is around 15-20 degrees cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cramer

customer_reviews.title: great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: works great . only wish it would turn off completely sometimes....its 50 and it still hums slowly ...
customer_reviews.author: Duradarshinee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat evacuation
customer_reviews.text: Pulls heat out of attic, quietness a plus as it sets in the center gable vent of attic
customer_reviews.author: curiouscat

customer_reviews.title: Caused our house to shake
customer_reviews.text: The fan was very loud and caused our house to shake. We have a ceiling fan in the bedroom that this was above and the fan now wobbles. I requested to return the item and now they want me to pay for the shipping. Would never recommend their product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Speed is not controllable.
customer_reviews.text: Chart in manual shows what speed fan will run based on the temperature. The hotter the temperature, the faster the fan runs. However, it appears that it only runs on the low speed if humidity over 60% is present. Wish it had variable (manual) adjustments to run faster in order to allow the moisture to clear out more quickly. Otherwise, great fan - quiet and vibration free.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat control is excellent. Also easy to disable the humidity sensor. Quiet.
customer_reviews.author: fredk

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after four months. E-mailed the company but never heard back. Product was very expensive for its short life.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Leandro

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This attic fan is super easy to install and works really well.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyThings

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, energy efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made, easy to install, and it performs well. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: D.Roe

customer_reviews.title: Powerful fan, takes care of my building and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Powerful fan, takes care of my building and it is not so noisy you can't hear the music on the radio.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Amazing...
customer_reviews.text: This attic fan is amazing. Easy to install and quiet. The 10 speed motor works great. My attic went from 132 degrees down to 80 degrees in 5 hours
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, quite and a very long cord!
customer_reviews.author: Della Bates

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like the automatic multi-speed motor. It saves energy, quieter at lower speeds, and should add to savings. Very easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Sabia

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Fan
customer_reviews.text: I installed this fan in our attic. It is working fine. It is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Larry T.

customer_reviews.title: Worried about quality. Alot.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in Mexico. OK. Except a bolt holding the motor frame to the green drum was never attached? (Box was clearly not tampered with - everything was sealed) Had to buy a locknut and bolt the motor to the drum. Inexcusable for a $349 fan. Photo provided.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Enright

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, Great support.
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace as the first one wouldn’t turn off. Had a quick exchange & great technical support directly from QuietCool allowed me to resolve the issues completely.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy replacement for original attic fan. Noise is a little more than original at high speed, but not terrible especially for the significant improvement in power.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My son easily installed this fan into the attic above our garage. It really helps pull heat out Of the house!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Best Attick fan
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet multi-speed auto on off and speed change. Best fan yet!
customer_reviews.author: Frank L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Fan!!
customer_reviews.text: This is soo much quieter and efficient than our previous fan. We'll worth the extra miney.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Melanson

customer_reviews.title: Works best during the day, gets attic a lot cooler, ac doent work as hard anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, did cool my house from 4-8 degrees difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Abellar

customer_reviews.title: Just click buy now and be done with the attic fan search
customer_reviews.text: Variable speed based on temperature. In south Florida it usually runs from low to speed 4. Quiet. Best gable fan I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kressly

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet attic fan.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding attic fan. It pulls a lot of hot air out very quietly. The fan is mounted on the gable end directly over our bedroom, but we cannot hear it running. We did use the optional rubber mounting mufflers that absorb vibration, I think doing so is a good idea. I wish that I had installed this unit 15 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Allen L.

customer_reviews.title: cool down your attic and save money
customer_reviews.text: This item was recommended to me by insulation expert and turned out to be so solid and easy to install that I just did it myself instead of having him do it. The difference was immediately noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: ET Philly

customer_reviews.title: Fan equals lower temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Installed fan in the attic with wood screws and rubber grommets, the noise level is extremely low and drop the heat by 15 degrees. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

product_meta.title: QuietCool Smart Attic Gable Fan (AFG SMT-3.0)
product_meta.description: Style:AFG SMT-3.0With the Quiet Cool SMART attic fan, gone are the days of having to adjust thermostat for your attic fan. Featuring a built-in thermostat and Humidistat, the self-adjusting, 10-speed ECM motor is always reading the temperature and humidity in the attic.
feature_bullets: Cool your overheated attic by up to 30-50 degrees
First attic fan with built-in thermostat and humidistat
Self adjusts automatically with a 10-speed ECM motor, as low as 22 watts
Prolong the life of your roof and home by preventing mold, moisture, humidity and excessive heat

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars169 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
